title: Osaka - Castle + Dotonbori
content:
Off the ferry and on the bus, taken straight to Osaka Castle!

We had a bit of a walk from the parking area, but it was a nice walk through the grounds, and a good chill way to get into the day.

Osaka Castle is impressive in a different way to Himeji - the inside had an exhibition throughout the floors, showing history surrounding the castle, which was really cool to see. The castle has quite a lot of gold coated elements around it, which really did give a different vibe to the experience - more opulent feeling rather than defensive / strategic at Himeji.

Next we were driven to Dotonbori for lunch and a little time to explore the chaos and do some shopping. We had Coco Curry for lunch since we didn't have ages and it was familiar. The shops and signage here are really something else - so many giant creatures trying to attract business. We did pick up some sweets from smaller shops along the way though, all of which were delicious.

Our hotel for the night was a little out of the city center, so we explored the local shopping area nearby, grabbed a simple dinner and called it a day.
